doc.ContractDescription: THE MASS EXTINCTION AT THE CRETACEOUS/PALEOGENE (K/PG) BOUNDARY HAD A DRASTIC IMPACT ON MARINE ECOSYSTEMS. A CONSIDERABLE BODY OF EVIDENCE SUPPORTS THE IMPACT AT CHICXULUB AS THE ULTIMATE TRIGGER OF THE MASS EXTINCTION, BUT THE DYNAMICS OF THE SUBSEQUENT RECOVERY ARE STILL NOT ENTIRELY UNDERSTOOD. THE DOMINANT SKELETONIZED PHYTOPLANKTON GROUPS AT THIS TIME INCLUDE THE CALCAREOUS NANNOPLANKTON, DINOFLAGELLATES AND DIATOMS. THE CALCAREOUS NANNOPLANKTON WERE DECIMATED WITH APPROXIMATELY 85% OF GENERA AND 93% OF SPECIES GOING EXTINCT. HOWEVER, DIATOMS HAD ~85% SURVIVAL ACROSS THE BOUNDARY AND DINOFLAGELLATES ACTUALLY INCREASED IN DIVERSITY. THESE NON-CALCAREOUS PLANKTON MOST LIKELY SURVIVED BECAUSE OF THEIR ABILITY TO FORM STRESS-RESISTANT RESTING CYSTS AND BECAUSE THEY WERE BETTER ADAPTED TO HIGH-STRESS ENVIRONMENTS. AS PART OF EXOBIOLOGY GRANT NNX07AK62 A LARGE, GLOBAL DATABASE OF NANNOPLANKTON ASSEMBLAGES ACROSS THE K/PG BOUNDARY WAS COMPILED LEADING TO THE DISCOVERY THAT THE NORTHERN HEMISPHERE OCEANS SUFFERED HIGHER NANNOPLANKTON EXTINCTION RATES THAN THE SOUTHERN HEMISPHERE WITH AN ECOLOGICAL "CRISIS" THAT LASTED FOR APPROXIMATELY 350 THOUSAND YEARS AFTER THE IMPACT. HOWEVER, NO STUDY HAS COMBINED ALL OF THE SKELETONIZED PLANKTON INTO A SINGLE INVESTIGATION TO DETERMINE HOW NON-CALCAREOUS PLANKTON INFLUENCED THE OCEANIC RECOVERY. THIS STUDY IS DESIGNED TO ASSESS HOW DIATOM, DINOFLAGELLATES AND NANNOPLANKTON ECOSYSTEMS, ESPECIALLY THOSE ON SHELVES, WERE ADAPTED TO SURVIVAL AT THE K/PG BOUNDARY. THIS INVESTIGATION WILL DETERMINE WHETHER SOUTHERN HEMISPHERE SHELF ENVIRONMENTS OFFERED REFUGES TO PHYTOPLANKTON TAXA IN THE IMMEDIATE WAKE OF THE IMPACT, WHETHER THESE ENVIRONMENTS "SEEDED" ASSEMBLAGES DURING THE RECOVERY INTERVAL, AND WHAT THE DIFFERENCE BETWEEN DIATOMS, DINOFLAGELLATES AND NANNOPLANKTON TELLS US ABOUT KILLING MECHANISMS AS WELL AS THE DYNAMICS OF THE RECOVERY. ECOLOGICAL RECOVERY OF ALL PHYTOPLANKTON GROUPS LIKELY TOOK PLACE ONLY AFTER THE BIOLOGIC PUMP WAS RESTORED AFTER THE K/PG EXTINCTION. THE PROPOSED STUDY IS ALSO DESIGNED TO REFINE OUR UNDERSTANDING OF HOW THE RECOVERY OF THE BIOLOGICAL PUMP CONTROLLED THE RECOVERY OF PHYTOPLANKTON ECOSYSTEMS. NANNOPLANKTON ASSEMBLAGES WILL BE STUDIED IN SELECTED NORTHERN HEMISPHERE SHELF SECTIONS AND IN MORE NUMEROUS SOUTHERN HEMISPHERE SHELF AND DEEP-SEA SECTIONS. INVESTIGATION OF NANNOPLANKTON WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED WHEREVER POSSIBLE WITH DIATOMS AND DINOFLAGELLATES: DIATOMS IN SOUTHERN HEMISPHERE SHELF SECTIONS AND DINOFLAGELLATES IN NORTHERN AND SOUTHERN HEMISPHERE SHELVES AND SLOPE DEPOSITS. IT IS HYPOTHESIZED THAT DIATOMS AND DINOFLAGELLATES MAY HAVE HELPED (VIA REMOVAL OF EXCESS NUTRIENTS AND METALS) OR HINDERED (VIA COMPETITION) THE RECOVERY OF NANNOPLANKTON. WE HAVE THE FOLLOWING PRIMARY HYPOTHESES TO EXPLAIN THE NATURE OF THE RECOVERY: 1. EARLIEST PALEOCENE NANNOPLANKTON ORIGINATED IN THE SHELF ENVIRONMENTS AND SPREAD THROUGH THE OCEAN AFTER THE K/PG EVENT; 2. THE SHELVES OFFERED A REFUGE FOR NANNOPLANKTON AT THE BOUNDARY, AND OTHER PLANKTON GROUPS (DIATOMS AND DINOFLAGELLATES) COULD HAVE EITHER HELPED OR HINDERED THE NANNOPLANKTON RECOVERY; 3. THE BIOLOGICAL PUMP PAVED THE WAY FOR SITES TO BECOME HABITABLE BY REMOVING TOXIC METALS AND EXCESS NUTRIENTS FROM THE SURFACE OCEAN; AND 4. SURFACE ACIDIFICATION WAS NOT SEVERE ENOUGH TO CAUSE EXTINCTION, BUT METAL POISONING AMPLIFIED EXTINCTION AND PROLONGED RECOVERY. DEVELOPMENT OF A HIGH-RESOLUTION STRATIGRAPHIC FRAMEWORK IN THE NORTHERN AND SOUTHERN HEMISPHERE SHELF AND SLOPE LOCATIONS AND AT SOUTHERN HEMISPHERE DEEP-SEA SITES WILL BE THE CORNERSTONE OF THE INVESTIGATION.

doc.ContractDescription: WE PROPOSE A GROUND-BASED STUDY OF THE ATMOSPHERES OF TRANSITING HOT JUPITERS WITH A NOVEL, HIGH PRECISION TECHNIQUE DIFFUSERASSISTED PHOTOMETRY. WE WILL APPLY THIS NEW TECHNIQUE TO PROPRIETARY GROUND-BASED TELESCOPES TO ACHIEVE UNPARALLELED PRECISIONS AND OBSERVING EFFICIENCY AT WAVELENGTHS COMPLEMENTARY TO SPITZER. BY COMBINING OUR GROUND-BASED SECONDARY ECLIPSE MEASUREMENTS WITH SPITZER DATA, WE AIM TO PROVIDE THE NECESSARY BROAD WAVELENGTH COVERAGE AND PRECISION TO BREAK ATMOSPHERIC MODEL DEGENERACIES FOR A LARGE SAMPLE OF HOT JUPITERS. WE WILL ENABLE COHERENT COMPARATIVE STUDIES THAT CAN SHED LIGHT ON THE FUNDAMENTAL PROCESSES AT WORK IN EXOPLANETARY ATMOSPHERES, AND OFFER INSIGHTS INTO THE ORIGINS OF THOSE PLANETS. SINCE SPITZER WILL BE UNAVAILABLE SOON AND JWST WILL NOT COME ON LINE FOR QUITE A FEW YEARS, OUR GROUND-BASED OBSERVATIONS WILL BE CRITICAL FOR THE UNDERSTANDING OF EXOPLANET ATMOSPHERES. WE ARE ESSENTIALLY EXTENDING THE LEGACY OF SPITZER TO THE GROUND BY CARRYING OUT A SUBSTANTIAL SAMPLE OF EXOPLANET ATMOSPHERE MEASUREMENTS WITH HIGH PRECISION. THIS WORK WILL ALSO PROVIDE HIGH-PRECISION GROUND-BASED TECHNIQUES FOR FUTURE TESS FOLLOW-UPS, AND WILL STRONGLY INFORM TARGETING AND SCIENCE GOALS FOR STUDIES OF GIANT PLANET ATMOSPHERES WITH JWST. THIS PROPOSAL SUPPORTS THE OBJECTIVES OF ORIGINS OF SOLAR SYSTEMS BECAUSE IT AIMS TO CHARACTERIZE EXOPLANETARY SYSTEMS WITH AN EMPHASIS ON OBTAINING NEW OBSERVABLES. OUR PROPOSAL FALLS INTO THE CATEGORIES OF: CHARACTERIZATION OF EXTRA-SOLAR PLANETS TO EXPLAIN OBSERVATIONS OF EXTRA-SOLAR PLANETS, AND IMPROVING UNDERSTANDING OF THE ORIGINS OF PLANETARY SYSTEMS. OUR RESEARCH HAS DIRECT RELEVANCE TO NASA'S STRATEGIC PLAN, SPECIFICALLY STRATEGIC GOAL 2 (EXPAND SCIENTIFIC UNDERSTANDING OF THE EARTH AND UNIVERSE IN WHICH WE LIVE), OUT- COME 2.4 (DISCOVER HOW THE UNIVERSE WORKS, EXPLORE HOW IT BEGAN AND EVOLVED, AND SEARCH FOR EARTH-LIKE PLANETS), AND OBJECTIVE 2.4.3 (GENERATE A CENSUS OF EXTRA-SOLAR PLANETS AND MEASURE THEIR PROPERTIES).

doc.ContractDescription: THE IMPRINT OF PATCHY REIONIZATION ON THE COSMIC MICROWAVE BACKGROUND COSMIC REIONIZATION IS A FRONTIER TOPIC IN COSMOLOGY WITH PLENTY OF SCIENTIFIC RICHNESS FOR THEORETICAL AND OBSERVATIONAL EXPLORATIONS. WHAT UNIQUELY MARKS THE EPOCH OF REIONIZATION (EOR) IS THE EMERGENCE OF THE FIRST LUMINOUS SOURCES. STUDYING THE EOR WILL REVEAL HOW THE FIRST GENERATION OF STARS, GALAXIES, AND QUASARS FORMED AND EVOLVED. IT CAN PROVIDE CONSTRAINTS ON COSMOLOGICAL PARAMETERS COMPARABLE TO STUDIES OF THE COSMIC MICROWAVE BACKGROUND (CMB). OVER THE NEXT FEW YEARS, CMB OBSERVATIONS ALONE HAVE THE POTENTIAL TO PROVIDE STRONG CONSTRAINTS ON THE EOR. INHOMOGENEOUS ELECTRON SCATTERING DURING THE EOR GENERATED SECONDARY TEMPERATURE FLUCTUATIONS AND INDUCED E-MODE POLARIZATION IN THE CMB. THE PLANCK SATELLITE WILL HAVE MUCH IMPROVED FULL-SKY MEASUREMENTS OF THE TEMPERATURE AND POLARIZATION POWER SPECTRA COMPARED. THE ATACAMA COSMOLOGY TELESCOPE WITH POLARIZATION (ACTPOL) AND SOUTH POLE TELESCOPE WITH POLARIZATION (SPTPOL) WILL COMPLIMENTARILY PROVIDE HIGHER RESOLUTION AND SENSITIVITY MEASUREMENTS OVER SEVERAL THOUSAND SQUARE DEGREES. THE PROPOSED PROJECT WILL STUDY THE IMPRINT OF COSMIC REIONIZATION ON THE CMB USING DIRECT COSMOLOGICAL (RADIATIVE TRANSFER + HYDRODYNAMIC + N-BODY) SIMULATIONS AND CALIBRATED SEMI-ANALYTICAL MODELS. THE COMPLEXITY OF REIONIZATION REQUIRES HIGH-RESOLUTION SIMULATIONS WITH BETTER PHYSICAL MODELS THAT CAN BE TESTED AGAINST HIGHREDSHIFT OBSERVATIONS. TO MODEL THE OBSERVATIONAL SIGNATURES, FASTER SEMI-ANALYTICAL TECHNIQUES ARE REQUIRED TO MAKE LARGE-SCALE MOCK OBSERVATIONS AND TO EXPLORE THE LARGE PARAMETER SPACE. RADIATION-HYDRODYNAMIC SIMULATIONS WILL BE RUN TO STUDY HOW THE DISTRIBUTION AND PROPERTIES OF RADIATION SOURCES AND SINKS AFFECT THE DETAILED HISTORY OF THE EOR. PARAMETRIC, SEMI-ANALYTICAL MODELS WILL BE USED TO CONSTRUCT LARGE-SCALE MOCK OBSERVATIONS. THE MODEL PARAMETERS WILL BE CALIBRATED AGAINST SIMULATIONS, BUT ARE VARIED AWAY FROM THE FIDUCIAL VALUES TO EXPLORE THE PARAMETER SPACE. THE IMPRINT OF ANISOTROPIC ELECTRON SCATTERING ON THE CMB TEMPERATURE AND POLARIZATION ANISOTROPIES WILL BE MODELED AND QUANTIFIED. KEY OBSERVABLES SUCH AS E-MODE POLARIZATION, PATCHY THOMSON SCATTERING, AND THE KINETIC SUNYAEV-ZEL'DOVICH EFFECT WILL BE THE MAJOR FOCUS. A LARGE DATABASE OF SIMULATIONS, MOCK OBSERVATIONS, FITTING TEMPLATES, AND VISUALIZATIONS WILL BE MADE PUBLICLY AVAILABLE TO THE SCIENTIFIC COMMUNITY TO FACILITATE WIDER COMPARISONS BETWEEN THEORETICAL CALCULATIONS AND OBSERVATIONAL DATA. THE PROPOSED RESEARCH IS IN ACCORDANCE WITH NASA ASTROPHYSICS GOALS WHICH IS BROADLY DEFINED AS TO "DISCOVER HOW THE UNIVERSE WORKS, EXPLORE HOW THE UNIVERSE BEGAN AND DEVELOPED INTO ITS PRESENT FORM, AND SEARCH FOR EARTH-LIKE PLANETS". THE PROPOSAL ATTEMPTS TO ANSWER THE TWO SUB-QUESTIONS: "HOW DO MATTER, ENERGY, SPACE, AND TIME BEHAVE UNDER THE EXTRAORDINARY DIVERSE CONDITIONS OF THE COSMOS?" AND "HOW DID THE UNIVERSE ORIGINATE AND EVOLVE TO PRODUCE THE GALAXIES, STARS, AND PLANETS WE SEE TODAY?" THE PROPOSED WORK ON THE CMB IS RELEVANT TO THE WILKINSON MICROWAVE ANISOTROPY PROBE (WMAP), WHICH IS A NASA MISSION, AND THE PLANCK SATELLITE, WHICH IS A EUROPEAN SPACE AGENCY MISSION WITH NASA PARTICIPATION. THE PROPOSED WORK ON HIGH-REDSHIFT GALAXIES IS RELEVANT TO NASA'S ONGOING HUBBLE SPACE TELESCOPE MISSION AND THE UPCOMING JAMES WEBB SPACE TELESCOPE MISSION.

doc.ContractDescription: WE PROPOSE A K2 SURVEY OF RUPRECHT 147. LONG THOUGHT TO BE AN ASTERISM, WE HAVE RECENTLY DEMONSTRATED THAT IT IS ACTUALLY THE OLDEST NEARBY STAR CLUSTER, WITH AN AGE OF 3 GYR AT A DISTANCE OF 300 PC (CURTIS ET AL. 2013, AJ, 145, 134). FOR COMPARISON, THE STARS IN THE SIMILARLY AGED KEPLER OPEN CLUSTER NGC 6819 ARE APPROXIMATELY 70 TIMES FAINTER, AND THOSE IN THE CLASSIC OLD BENCHMARK M67 ARE NEARLY 10 TIMES FAINTER. THIS PROXIMITY HAS ALLOWED US TO OBTAIN HIGH-RESOLUTION SPECTRA FOR NEARLY THE ENTIRE MEMBERSHIP, ENABLING STUDIES OF CHROMOSPHERIC ACTIVITY, LITHIUM DEPLETION, AND DETAILED STELLAR CHARACTERIZATIONS; OUR AO IMAGING RESOLVES BINARIES WITH ONLY 50 AU SEPARATIONS; WE CAN SPECTROSCOPICALLY IDENTIFY AND CHARACTERIZE THE WHITE DWARFS AND RED DWARFS; AND WE CAN MEASURE CORONAL X-RAY LUMINOSITIES FROM SUN-LIKE STARS DOWN TO THE EARLY K DWARFS WITH CHANDRA DATA IN-HAND. RUPRECHT 147 IS LOCATED IN SAGITTARIUS, AND SAT JUST BEYOND THE EDGE OF THE PROPOSED FIELD FOR K2 CAMPAIGN 7, UNTIL WE SUCCESSFULLY LED A PETITION FOR A POINTING ADJUSTMENT TO ACCOMMODATE THE CLUSTER. OUR PROPOSED K2 SURVEY WILL PROVIDE ASTEROSEISMIC DATA FOR THE UPPER MAIN SEQUENCE TURNOFF AND EVOLVED STARS. THIS WILL YIELD AN INDEPENDENT AGE CONSTRAINT FOR THIS UNIQUE BENCHMARK CLUSTER, BASED ON THE STELLAR MASSES DERIVED FOR THE RED GIANT BRANCH. WE WILL MEASURE ROTATION PERIODS FOR 3 GYR FGKM DWARFS. THESE DATA ARE SORELY NEEDED FOR GYROCHRONOLOGY CALIBRATION, AND WILL DEMONSTRATE THE ABILITY OF STELLAR SPIN DOWN TO DIFFERENTIATE BETWEEN 2.5 GYR (NGC 6819 KEPLER PRIME), 3 GYR (R147) AND 4 GYR (M67 CAMPAIGN 5) AGES (MEIBOM ET AL. 2015, NATURE). R147S PROXIMITY ALLOWS K2 TO PROVIDE HIGHER QUALITY DATA FOR MEMBERS OF MUCH LOWER MASS THAN FOR THE DISTANT NGC 6819. PAIRING THESE ROTATION PERIODS WITH OUR CHROMOSPHERIC AND CORONAL X-RAY DATA WILL PROVIDE A COMPREHENSIVE VIEW OF ANGULAR MOMENTUM AND MAGNETIC DYNAMO EVOLUTION AT 3 GYR. THE 8-HOUR PHOTOMETRIC VARIABILITY SIGNAL KNOWN AS FLICKER, KNOWN TO TRACE STELLAR DENSITY AND SURFACE GRAVITY, IS ALSO DETECTABLE IN K2 LIGHT CURVES (BASTIEN ET AL. 2013, NATURE, 500, 427). WE WILL CONSTRUCT A COLOR-FLICKER DIAGRAM FOR R147, WHICH WILL (1) TEST IF K2 FLICKER MEASUREMENTS PROPERLY ORDER THE CLUSTER SEQUENCE, AND THEREFORE PRODUCE ACCURATE RELATIVE GRAVITIES, (2) POTENTIALLY OFFER FLICKER CALIBRATION FOR LOWER MASS STARS LACKING SEISMIC CALIBRATION, AND (3) TEST SIGNAL-TO-NOISE DEPENDENCE, IN COMPARISON TO A SIMILAR COLORFLICKER DIAGRAM ASSEMBLED FOR M67 FROM CAMPAIGN 5. CALIBRATING AND VALIDATING K2 FLICKER WILL HAVE BROAD IMPACT FOR THE ENTIRE K2 MISSION. FINALLY, ALL 1200 ASTROMETRIC-PHOTOMETRIC MEMBERS WILL BE SURVEYED FOR STELLAR AND EXOPLANETARY TRANSITS. IF ANY LOW MASS ECLIPSING BINARIES ARE DISCOVERED, THEY COULD BECOME IMPORTANT TOUCHSTONES BECAUSE WE ALSO KNOW THEIR AGES AND COMPOSITIONS. K2 IS SENSITIVE TO 2 EARTH RADIUS EXOPLANETS AROUND FGKM DWARFS IN R147.
doc.MajorAgency: K2 SURVEY OF RUPRECHT 147 - THE OLDEST NEARBY STAR
doc.MajorFundingAgency: K2 SURVEY OF RUPRECHT 147 - THE OLDEST NEARBY STAR
doc.ProductorServiceCode: AR21: R&D- SPACE: SCIENCE/APPLICATIONS (BASIC RESEARCH)

doc.ContractDescription: WE PROPOSE TO CONTINUE THE HIGHLY SUCCESSFUL PROGRAM TO USE SWIFT TO PERFORM LOCALIZATION OF GALACTIC X-RAY TRANSIENTS NEWLY DISCOVERED BY MAXI. MAXI SCANS ALMOST THE ENTIRE X-RAY SKY EVERY ~91 MINUTES, WITH A SOURCE DETECTION SENSITIVITY OF ~60 MCRAB IN ONE ORBIT AND ~15 MCRAB IN ONE DAY, DISCOVERING X-RAY TRANSIENTS WITH 0.1-0.5 DEGREE ACCURACIES IN THE 0.5-20 KEV ENERGY BAND. SWIFT IS ABLE TO PROVIDE RAPID FOLLOW-UP OBSERVATIONS OF MAXI TRIGGERS AND LOCALIZATION<3.5 ARC-SECOND ERROR RADIUS, WHICH IS VITAL FOR IDENTIFYING ANY OPTICAL/RADIO COUNTERPART. XRT OBSERVATIONS WILL ALSO PROVIDE MEASUREMENTS OF THE LOW ENERGY X-RAY SPECTRA. UVOT WILL BE USED TO PROVIDE ASTROMETRIC CORRECTIONS, AND TO SEARCH FOR ANY OPTICAL COUNTERPARTS. SWIFT IS PROVEN TO BE UNIQUELY CAPABLE IN THIS TASK.
doc.MajorAgency: SWIFT LOCALIZATION OF MAXI DISCOVERED GALACTIC X-R
doc.MajorFundingAgency: SWIFT LOCALIZATION OF MAXI DISCOVERED GALACTIC X-R

doc.ContractDescription: THE NEXT MAJOR X-RAY ASTRONOMY OBSERVATORY WILL BE ESAS L2 MISSION, WHICH IS LIKELY TO BE THE ADVANCED TELESCOPE FOR HIGH-ENERGY ASTROPHYSICS (ATHENA). ONE OF THE CORE ATHENA INSTRUMENTS, THE WIDE FIELD IMAGER (WFI), IS DESIGNED TO CONDUCT SENSITIVE OBSERVATIONS OF BOTH BRIGHT AND FAINT X-RAY SOURCES USING A WIDE FIELD OF VIEW AND A NEW TYPE OF DEVICE KNOWN AS A DEPFET (DEPLETED P-CHANNEL FIELD EFFECT TRANSISTOR) DETECTOR, WHICH HAS AN EXTREMELY RAPID READOUT CAPABILITY. A KEY TECHNOLOGY REQUIRED TO READ OUT AND PROCESS THE DATA FROM AN ARRAY OF DEPFET DETECTORS IS A VERY HIGH SPEED HARDWARE/FIRMWARE EVENT RECOGNITION PROCESSOR. WE HAVE DEVELOPED A DESIGN CONCEPT AND ARE SEEKING FUNDS TO ADVANCE THE DESIGN TO TRL 4.
doc.MajorAgency: FAST EVENT RECOGNITION FOR THE ATHENA WIDE FIELD I

doc.ContractDescription: IGF::OT::IGF THIS FIRM-FIXED-PRICE (FFP) CONTRACT PROVIDES TECHNICAL SUPPORT SERVICES TO ASSIST THE U.S. COAST GUARD (USCG), OFFICE OF STANDARDS EVALUATION AND DEVELOPMENT (CG-REG), IN ITS COMPLIANCE WITH EXECUTIVE ORDER (EO) 12886, REGULATORY PLANNING AND REVIEW, AND THE GREAT LAKES PILOTAGE ACT OF 1960.
doc.ProductorServiceCode: B507: SPECIAL STUDIES/ANALYSIS- ECONOMIC

doc.ContractDescription: THE PROPOSED GRADUATE RESEARCH ATTEMPTS TO ADDRESS MULTIPLE QUESTIONS OF THE NASA SCIENCE MISSION DIRECTORATE SMD. ONE OF THE OVERALL GOALS OF THE NASA SMD IS TO ADVANCE KNOWLEDGE OF EARTH AS A SYSTEM TO IMPROVE LIFE ON OUR PLANET. THIS WORK WOULD COMBINE DATA FROM MULTIPLE SATELLITE SENSORS AS WELL AS IMAGE BASED DATASETS OF SHORT AND LONG TERM MEASUREMENTS TO STUDY ACTIVE VOLCANIC PROCESSES TO UNDERSTAND THESE PHENOMENA AND PROTECT LIVES AND PROPERTY. THE PRIMARY OVERARCHING GOAL OF THIS PROPOSAL IS THE NASA EARTH SCIENCE FOCUS AREA GOAL CHARACTERIZE THE DYNAMICS OF EARTH S SURFACE AND INTERIOR, IMPROVING THE CAPABILITY TO ASSESS AND RESPOND TO NATURAL HAZARDS AND EXTREME EVENTS. THE FUNDAMENTAL HYPOTHESIS OF THIS PROPOSAL IS, CAN PROXIMAL AND OPTICALLY THICK VOLCANIC PLUMES BE TREATED AS AN EMITTING SURFACE AND THEREFORE TO WHAT ACCURACY CAN TIR DATA BE USED TO DERIVE COMPOSITION, PARTICLE SIZE, AND LONGWAVE LW RADIATIVE FORCING? VOLCANIC PLUMES ARE A COMPLEX MIXTURE OF GAS AND SOLID PARTICLES OF MINERAL FRAGMENTS AND VOLCANIC GLASSES OF VARYING SIZES. BY EXAMINING THESE PRODUCTS, WE CAN GAIN A MUCH GREATER UNDERSTANDING OF THE DYNAMICS OF ERUPTION PLUMES AND THE UNDERLYING PROCESSES THAT GENERATE THEM. THIS ANALYSIS WILL THEREFORE ADDRESS ONE OF THE MAIN QUESTIONS OF THE EARTH SURFACE AND INTERIOR ESI SCIENCE FOCUS AREA, HOW DO MAGMATIC SYSTEMS EVOLVE AND UNDER WHAT CONDITIONS DO VOLCANOES ERUPT? FURTHERMORE, ONCE PLUMES HAVE BEEN GENERATED, THEY CAN MOVE GREAT DISTANCES AND HAVE SOME EFFECT ON BOTH REGIONAL AND GLOBAL CLIMATE. THE SHORT TERM AND LOCAL EFFECTS ON LW RADIATIVE FORCING OF THESE SPECIES ARE NOT FULLY UNDERSTOOD, PARTICULARLY IN THE CASE OF VOLCANIC ASH. THE RESULTS OF THIS WORK WILL THEREFORE PROVIDE INSIGHT INTO THE ATMOSPHERIC COMPOSITION FOCUS AREA MISSION STATEMENT TO ADVANCE THE UNDERSTANDING OF CHANGES IN THE EARTH S RADIATION BALANCE, AIR QUALITY THAT RESULT FROM CHANGES IN ATMOSPHERIC COMPOSITION, BY EXAMINING THE COMPLEX ROLES OF TRANSMISSION, ABSORPTION, AND EMISSION BY THESE CLOUDS. THIS IN TURN PROVIDES A CROSSOVER TO THE CLIMATE VARIABILITY AND CHANGE GOAL, TO IMPROVE THE ABILITY TO PREDICT CLIMATE CHANGES BY BETTER UNDERSTANDING THE ROLES AND INTERACTIONS OF THE ATMOSPHERE, LAND IN THE CLIMATE SYSTEM. THE WORK WILL USE SPECTRAL DATA DERIVED FROM A NEWLYDEVELOPED ASH FLOW CHAMBER IN THE LABORATORY AS WELL AS FROM THE ADVANCED SPACEBORNE THERMAL EMISSION AND REFLECTION RADIOMETER ASTER SENSOR AND ITS URGENT REQUEST PROTOCOL URP ARCHIVE, WHICH HAS BEEN DEVELOPED FOR DETECTING AND MITIGATING VOLCANIC HAZARDS. IN ADDITION TO ASTER, THIS WORK IS ADAPTABLE TO ALLOW OTHER EOS INSTRUMENTS ON THE TERRA, AQUA AND AURA E.G. MODIS, AIRS, ETC SATELLITES TO BE USED TO GAIN A BETTER UNDERSTAND OF THE ERUPTIVE COMPOSITION, VOLCANIC CHANGES TO THE ATMOSPHERE, AND HAZARDS POSED BY VOLCANIC ASH CLOUDS.
doc.MajorAgency: ANALYSIS OF PROXIMAL VOLCANIC EMISSIONS
doc.MajorFundingAgency: ANALYSIS OF PROXIMAL VOLCANIC EMISSIONS
doc.ProductorServiceCode: AR21: R&D- SPACE: SCIENCE/APPLICATIONS (BASIC RESEARCH)

doc.ContractDescription: IGF::OT::IGF THE THERMAL TRANSPORT REQUIREMENTS FOR FUTURE SPACECRAFT MISSIONS CONTINUE TO INCREASE, APPROACHING SEVERAL KILOWATTS. AT THE SAME TIME THE HEAT ACQUISITION AREAS HAVE TRENDED DOWNWARD, THEREBY INCREASING THE INCIDENT HEAT FLUX. CURRENT INCIDENT HEAT FLUX FOR LASER DIODE APPLICATIONS IS ON THE ORDER OF 5-10W/CM2, ALTHOUGH THIS IS EXPECTED TO INCREASE TOWARDS 50W/CM2. THIS IS A SEVERE LIMITATION FOR AXIAL GROOVE ALUMINUM/AMMONIA CONSTANT CONDUCTANCE HEAT PIPES (CCHPS). THE MAXIMUM HEAT FLUX IN A CCHP IS SET BY THE BOILING LIMIT, WHICH TYPICALLY START AT 5 W/CM2 FOR AXIAL GROVE WICKS, AND 20-30 W/CM2 FOR POWDER METAL WICKS. THE INNOVATION IS TO DEVELOP CCHPS WITH A HYBRID WICK, WHICH HAS A SINTERED EVAPORATOR WICK, AND A CONVENTIONAL GROOVED ADIABATIC AND CONDENSER WICK. THESE HYBRID WICKS CAN OPERATE AT HIGHER HEAT FLUXES, ALLOWING THE USE OF HIGHER POWER LASER DIODES. THEY ALSO ALLOW THE USE OF VARIABLE CONDUCTANCE HEAT PIPES (VCHPS) IN LUNAR AND MARTIAN LANDERS AND ROVERS, WHICH MUST OPERATE AT TILTS UP TO 45. CONVENTIONAL ALUMINUM/AMMONIA HEAT PIPES CAN ONLY OPERATE WITH A 0.1 INCH TILT, SO THEY ARE UNSUITABLE. LOOP HEAT PIPES CAN ALSO OPERATE WITH TILTING, BUT THEY ARE TWO ORDERS OF MAGNITUDE MORE EXPENSIVE. A HYBRID GROOVED AND SINTERED WICK CCHP WILL ALLOW OPERATING AT HIGHER HEAT FLUXES AS COMPARED TO AXIAL GROOVE DESIGN AND CAN ALSO OPERATE AGAINST GRAVITY ON THE PLANETARY SURFACE, OPERATE IN SPACE, CARRYING POWER OVER LONG DISTANCES, ACT AS A THERMOSYPHON ON THE PLANETARY SURFACE FOR LUNAR AND MARTIAN LANDERS AND ROVERS, AND DEMONSTRATE A HIGHER TRANSPORT CAPABILITY THAN AN ALL-SINTERED WICK.
doc.MajorAgency: HYBRID HEAT PIPES FOR HIGH HEAT FLUX APPLICATIONS
doc.MajorFundingAgency: HYBRID HEAT PIPES FOR HIGH HEAT FLUX APPLICATIONS
doc.ProductorServiceCode: AR11: R&D- SPACE: AERONAUTICS/SPACE TECHNOLOGY (BASIC RESEARCH)

doc.AgencyID: 7523: CENTERS FOR DISEASE CONTROL AND PREVENTION
doc.ProductorServiceCode: Z1JZ: MAINTENANCE OF MISCELLANEOUS BUILDINGS
doc.RecipientAddressLine123: 3901 OLD INTERNATIONAL AIRPORT RD STE 200 J, ,

doc.ContractDescription: USING BOTH ASTER THERMAL INFRARED (TIR) AND VISIBLE-NEAR INFRARED (VNIR), WITH ERS-2 AND ALOS PALSAR MICROWAVE SAR SENSORS (C- AND L-BANDS) THERE IS AN OPPORTUNITY TO FORECAST FUTURE EXPLOSIVE VOLCANIC ACTIVITY IN HIGHLY POPULATED, DEVELOPING COUNTRIES. THE RESEARCH PROPOSED HERE WILL FIRST REFINE MODELS OF SURFACE COMPOSITION AND ROUGHNESS USING PUMICE AND OBSIDIAN SAMPLES FROM MONO DOMES (CALIFORNIA, USA) BEFORE APPLICATION TO EXISTING PYROCLASTIC FLOW AND LAHAR DEPOSITS AT MERAPI VOLCANO (INDONESIA) AND SHIVELUCH VOLCANO (RUSSIA). SHIVELUCH AND MERAPI VOLCANOES HAVE HAD NUMEROUS ERUPTIONS IN THE PAST DECADE THAT HAVE PRODUCED MANY DIVERSE SIZES AND STYLES OF FLOW DEPOSITS. IT IS HYPOTHESIZED THAT SURFACE TEXTURE AND COMPOSITION OF LAHAR AND PDC DEPOSITS CAN BE CHARACTERIZED USING TIR AND SAR DATA TO UNDERSTAND THE ERUPTIONS THAT FORMED THEM. THIS WILL BE ACHIEVED THROUGH QUANTIFYING AND INTEGRATING: 1) DEPOSIT MORPHOLOGY; 2) MICRON- (VESICULARITY) SCALE AND CM- (BLOCK SIZE) ROUGHNESS; AND 3) COMPOSITION. THESE PARAMETERS INDICATE MAGMA COMPOSITION, VOLATILE CONTENT AND FRAGMENTATION CONDITIONS AND THE INTEGRATION OF THESE DATASETS AIMS TO IDENTIFY DEPOSIT TYPE AND ORIGINATING ERUPTIVE STYLE, AND RESULTING HAZARDS TO LOCAL POPULATION AND PROPERTY. THIS DATABASE CAN GIVE INSIGHT TO THE MAGMA SYSTEM EVOLUTION AND FUTURE ERUPTION STYLE TO AID IN DISASTER MANAGEMENT AND DECISION MAKING. COMPOSITIONAL DATA WILL BE DERIVED USING SATELLITE THERMAL INFRARED SPECTRAL DECONVOLUTION METHODS DESCRIBED BY RAMSEY AND CHRISTENSEN (1998). MICRON-SCALE SURFACE ROUGHNESS WILL BE QUANTIFIED BY IMPROVING THE VESICULARITY MODEL DEVELOPED BY RAMSEY AND FINK (1999) USING A TWO-COMPONENT SPECTRAL DECONVOLUTION MODEL APPLIED TO TIR WAVELENGTHS AND COMPARED TO SEMDERIVED ROUGHNESS VALUES. THESE RESULTS WILL BE EXTENDED TO SURFACE MORPHOLOGY DERIVED FROM OPTICAL WAVELENGTHS, AND BLOCK SIZE MEASUREMENTS DERIVED FROM SAR DATA OF THE SAME FLOWS AND SUBSEQUENTLY CORRELATED TO PREVIOUS GROUND- AND LAB- BASED STUDIES OF THESE DEPOSITS. THE DATA PRODUCED BY THIS RESEARCH WILL BE CORRELATED TO PAST VOLCANIC ACTIVITY, AND THEN COMBINED WITH TOPOGRAPHICAL DATA FOR VOLCANIC HAZARD APPLICATION TO ASSESS RISK TO LOCAL POPULATIONS. THIS RESEARCH AIMS TO IMPROVE REMOTE SENSING MODELING OF EXPLOSIVE ERUPTIONS THROUGH STUDIES IN AREAS DIFFICULT TO ACCESS AND MONITOR, INCLUDING HUMID, CLOUD-COVERED ENVIRONMENTS THAT ARE A CHALLENGE TO REMOTE SENSING, WHICH ARE AREAS THAT COMMONLY HAVE INCREASED POPULATIONS IN HARM'S WAY.

doc.ContractDescription: METHANE IS THE SECOND MOST POWERFUL GREENHOUSE GAS (GHG) AFTER CARBON DIOXIDE. THE CONCENTRATION OF METHANE HAS BEEN INCREASED FROM 700 PPB IN PRE-INDUSTRIAL TIMES TO 1758-1874 PPB IN RECENT YEARS. ONE MAJOR ANTHROPOGENIC METHANE SOURCE IS THE NATURAL GAS AND OIL DEVELOPMENT, WHICH CONTRIBUTES TO 23% OF THE TOTAL ANTHROPOGENIC METHANE EMISSION IN 2012. EXTRACTIONS OF NATURAL GAS FROM UNCONVENTIONAL SOURCES, ESPECIALLY SHALE GAS, ARE A RAPIDLY GROWING DOMESTIC ENERGY SOURCE IN RECENT YEARS. HOWEVER, RECENT WORK SHOWED THAT METHANE EMISSIONS FROM NATURAL GAS AND OIL PRODUCTION ARE UNDERESTIMATED BY THE CURRENT EMISSION INVENTORY. THUS, DEVELOPING MORE RELIABLE DATASETS ON METHANE EMISSIONS FROM SHALE GAS DEVELOPMENT IS OF GREAT SIGNIFICANCE TO UNDERSTAND THE GAP OF CURRENT ESTIMATION AND HOW THE RAPID INCREASE OF SHALE GAS EXTRACTIONS ALTER THE METHANE LEVELS IN THE ATMOSPHERE. THE PI OF THIS PROJECT, PROF. ALBERT PRESTO, IS CURRENTLY LEADING A DOE-NETL FUNDED PROJECT TO MEASURE METHANE EMISSIONS FROM NATURAL GAS PRODUCTIONS IN THE MARCELLUS SHALE REGION, WHICH IS ONE MAJOR SHALE GAS FORMATION IN U.S. THE TEAM HAS ALREADY MEASURED OVER 30 FACILITIES. HOWEVER, SINCE METHANE EMISSIONS ARE HIGHLY VARIABLE FOR DIFFERENT FACILITIES, HOW WELL THESE SAMPLED FACILITIES REFLECT THE OVERALL METHANE EMISSIONS FROM SHALE GAS DEVELOPMENT REMAIN UNCERTAIN. HERE WE PROPOSE TO COMPLEMENT THIS BOTTOM-UP MEASUREMENT WITH THE TOP-DOWN INVERSE MODELING TO INFER METHANE EMISSIONS. THE RETRIEVED METHANE ABUNDANCE FROM SATELLITE DATA INCLUDING SCIAMACHY (2008-2012), GOSAT (2008-2014) AND TES (2008-2014)WILL FIRST BE VALIDATED WITH IN SITU MEASUREMENTS FROM NOAA S CARBONTRACKER SYSTEM (2008-2014) AND NASA S DISCOVER-AQ AIRCRAFT CAMPAIGN (2011-2013). THEN THE SATELLITE AND IN SITU METHANE MEASUREMENTS WILL BE COMBINED TO CONSTRAIN METHANE EMISSIONS WITH THE BAYESIAN INVERSION, WHICH WILL BE CONDUCTED WITH GEOS-CHEM ON THE NORTH AMERICAN SUBDOMAIN WITH A SPECIFIC FOCUS ON MARCELLUS REGION FROM 2008 TO 2014. A PREDETERMINED A PRIORI EMISSION FIELD WILL BE IMPLEMENTED INTO GEOS-CHEM AND BE ITERATIVELY SCALED UNTIL THE MODELED METHANE CONCENTRATIONS MATCH THE REMOTE SENSING AND IN SITU OBSERVATIONS. FINALLY, WE WILL CHECK WHETHER THE BOTTOM-UP AND THE TOP-DOWN ESTIMATIONS AGREE WITH EACH OTHER WITHIN ACCEPTABLE UNCERTAINTIES. TO OUR KNOWLEDGE, CURRENTLY THERE ARE VERY FEW METHANE INVERSE MODELING WORKS FOCUSING ON MARCELLUS REGION WITH A TIME PERIOD AFTER 2010. ALSO, VERY FEW WORKS CONDUCTED METHANE INVERSE MODELING WITH MULTI-YEAR SATELLITE DATA SETS; MULTI-YEAR SATELLITE DATA SETS COULD REVEAL HOW THE GROWTH OF SHALE GAS DEVELOPMENT ENHANCED THE REGIONAL ATMOSPHERIC METHANE ABUNDANCE AND PROVIDE VALUABLE INFORMATION ON INVERSE MODELING. THE COMBINATION OF THE TOP-DOWN AND BOTTOM-UP MAKES OUR RESULTS MORE RELIABLE COMPARED WITH WORKS THAT ONLY USE ONE METHOD. THE UNCERTAINTIES OF THE BOTTOM-UP INVENTORIES CAN BE NARROWED DOWN BY THE TOP-DOWN ESTIMATION; AND THE SOURCE APPORTIONMENT BASED ON BOTTOM-UP MEASUREMENTS CAN BE USED TO VERIFY THE SOURCE ATTRIBUTION OF THE TOP-DOWN MODELING. THE PROPOSED WORK WILL PROVIDE A BETTER ESTIMATION OF THE METHANE EMISSION RATES FROM SHALE GAS DEVELOPMENT IN MARCELLUS SHALE REGION, WHICH WILL ALSO PROVIDE A BETTER UNDERSTANDING ON THE CHANGE OF THE METHANE BURDEN IN THE ATMOSPHERE. THIS IS ALIGNED WELL WITH THE NASA S GOAL OF UNDERSTANDING THE CHANGING OF ATMOSPHERIC COMPOSITION. ON THE POLICY PERSPECTIVE, SINCE NATURAL GAS HAS BEEN CONSIDERED AS BRIDGE FUEL BECAUSE IT EMITS LESS CO2 THAN OTHER FOSSIL FUELS DURING COMBUSTION, YET TOO MUCH METHANE EMISSIONS MAY OFFSET THIS BENEFIT, A BETTER ESTIMATION OF MARCELLUS SHALE METHANE EMISSIONS IS ALSO IMPORTANT TO JUSTIFY THE DEVELOPMENT OF SHALE GAS. MOREOVER, THE PROPOSED WORK WILL VALIDATE NASA S SATELLITE DATA (TES) AND WILL ALSO USE DATA FROM NASA S SATELLITE (TES) AND NASA S FILED CAMPAIGN (DISCOVER-AQ) TO IDENTIFY LOCAL METHANE SOURCES
doc.MajorAgency: CONSTRAINING MARCELLUS SHALE METHANE EMISSIONS WIT
